dialogues.text: (brightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never know 'til you walk through that door! Eddie dismisses him with a flap of his hand and sprints t catch up with the others. Pritchett yells after him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't consider getting my check and running it back down here? No response. Beat. Pritchett gets out of his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't think so. Asshole. He starts jittering his way up the drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold. Flinty. Two stories high and domed, with a stained glass skylight topping it. Despite their varied states of confusion, the four Guests stop in their tracks as they enter, struck dumb with awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Jesus H. Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's the party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we're it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More to the point. Where's our host?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More to the point: what in the name of fuck is that? She's pointing up at the stained glass skylight. It seems depict a Man with dozens of hideous creatures hovering ro his head. And above them all looms a huge something with wings and flaming claws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More of Price's spook-house bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all! They turn to see Pritchett's head poking through the door -- putting as little of himself as possible inside the ho proper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of the original structure. When it was still an asylum. Guy who ran the place -- Dr. Vannacutt -- found it "inspirational." From some German cathedral a million years ago: "Driving the Demons From the Mind."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm moved beyond words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hint of still weirder shit to come, I can only hope. She whips the Camcorder to her eye and starts recording e detail of the skylight. Dr. Blackburn rolls his eyes. Pritchett starts calling loudly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Price? Mrs. Price? Somebody? Hello??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pritchett, take it down a couple hundred decibels, what is your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problem? No problem -- just want to get my money and get on home -- you know, things to see, people to do? He laughs weakly; starts shouting again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Price?? Mrs. Price?? Melissa Marr continues to shoot up a storm of tape in the room, as overexcited as a five-year-old who's lost her Ritalin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew this whole place'd be pure gold! Pritchett, point me in the direction of the goddamn ghosts! If I can get something bizarre enough on tape, I think I can parlay it into getting me some kind'a Robert Stack "Unsolved Most- Wacked-Out Home Videos" gig. No more five afternoons a week of sex-change- Nazis-and-the-lesbos-that-love-'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got your own TV show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy whose hair I do has his own TV show. All I've got is a blow-dryer and a dream. Sara's staring at something that's making her more nervou the second:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, excuse me -- but does anybody know any logical reason why those little demons would be moving? She's pointing to the skylight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? She whips her camera up at the stained glass. Zooms in. T beat. And then lowers the camera, sighing in disappointme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...birds. Just seagulls or something walking on the glass, goddammit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheer up: before the night's through, I'm sure one of us'll get hacked to pieces by somebody or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may start right now. All heads turn again -- standing in the open front doorwa dressed absolutely to kill is a not-terribly-pleased-look EVELYN STOCKARD-PRICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are all of you?? -- and right on that beat: the huge dome of STAINED GLASS above them all EXPLODES! All heads whip up -- as time seems to stand still -- and begins raining COLORED SHARDS in the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...my...God.... IN SLOW MOTION -- We see the rest of the Guests instinctively start to duck and cover against the deluge all except EVELYN who's staring up at the descending projectiles with a profound look of annoyance on her face EDDIE - notices that a huge DEMON-HEADED GLASS SHARD is hurtling, razor-point-down, for Evelyn's head! With an athlete's reflexes, he hurls his body at hers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Jesus, lady! -- -- tackling her to the floor, the giant SHARD missing her skull by literally a hair. It plunges six inches deep int the parquet, THWANGS like an arrow into a target. Beat of absolute sheer STUNNED SILENCE. And then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Everyone else stares at Evelyn, who's not moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she...alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought she was dead. For sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even fucking close. (seething; to Eddie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get...off...of...me. It's like being spit at by a cobra; Eddie doesn't have to told twice. Leaps off her, and Evelyn slowly, angrily get her feet, a trickle of blood coming down her cheek from a small cut there. A VOICE is heard from somewhere O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not dead now, but soon. All eyes look up to see: STEVEN PRICE perched on the balc rail above them in formal wear, legs crossed, cigar in ha blowing out smoke through highly bemused lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's been marked for it. The House does that. Happened to Pritchett's father. Likely happen to you all. Isn't that what you told me, Mr. Pritchett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't remember at the moment. Blackburn applies his handkerchief to Evelyn's bleeding cheek. She recoils:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm impressed: I don't think Evelyn's ever said those words to anything with genitalia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not laughing, Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be -- you were nearly just killed, sweetheart. (to the guests)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now that our birthday girl is finally here, let the games begin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't they already? Price just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure is a funky old house, ain't it? She glares back at him, steaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we have a word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I think we're going to have several. Evelyn doesn't have to be invited, she's already stomping halfway up the stairs. Price smiles down at the Guests:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll just take a moment -- you'll find food and booze in the main salon, knock yourselves out. Evelyn grabs him hard by the arm and yanks him back into shadows; they disappear from sight. The Guests just stand there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what? The thing with the glass? Price did that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he did, for God's sake. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't he, Mr. Pritchett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't comment until I get paid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surrounded by idiots. Blackburn walks off into the Main Salon near the Foyer. T others shrug and follow him, except for Pritchett, who sh upstairs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Price??? No response from anyone. Pritchett's eyes jitterbug all around him -- he sees he's standing there alone. As nonchalantly as he can, he quick -- steps towards the Sal and the others -- passing right by a barely perceptible black dot in the wall, no larger than a dime --

dialogues.speaker: TRAVELING THROUGH WALLS
dialogues.text: -- and we PUSH IN on this DOT, until we're inside it, on the OTHER SIDE OF THE WALL and see that's it's connected COAXIAL CABLE, which we FOLLOW past ancient, decaying bea and mortar, past VERMIN -- rodent and insect, both -- tha skitter maniacally right in our faces -- and then right into the innards of the multi-wired CABLE itself -- emerg out near...

dialogues.speaker: A VIDEO MONITOR
dialogues.text: -- that's atop a table with several other monitors and a literal Circuit City's worth of electronic and computer equipment, all of it inside a --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- in which sits Steven Price's engineer SCHECTER, in his coveralls, eating a sandwich, as he mans Haunted House Central Control. He hits a combination of keys on the computer. On one of the Monitors we see a door somewhere inside the House rapidly open-and-shut, open-and-shut. Nods with satisfaction, then YELPS! as he spots a MILLIPE wriggling out of his tuna salad, straight into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! He flicks the insect away, nearly gagging. It lands on another VIDEO MONITOR that is trained on a room on the up floor of the place. Some space that looks like it was goi to be a bedroom, once upon a time: a lot of strange, ultr modern furniture: all of it metal and of bizarre angles a shapes. And then into that room storms Evelyn and Price. PUSH IN on that video screen and suddenly we're there:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Evelyn slams the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave you a goddamn guest list two pages long -- where the hell are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shredded. Sorry. Decided to whip up one of my own: a group so hungry for money that they'd be willing to do anything. I thought you'd be more comfortable with your peers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it was stupid of me not to expect something this twisted from you. Well, congratu-fucking-lations, Steven: Round One, you win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not quite. See, those people down there: they aren't the ones I invited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me. I don't know how you managed to hack into my Mac, but: bravo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? You think I invited them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure know it wasn't me. And if you say it wasn't you -- then who the hell did, Evelyn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It you really loved me, Steven, you'd find a way to drop dead in the next three seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finding ways for me to die at these things is really your deal, isn't it? The "O.J." knife with the not-quite- retractable blade? Your "Jim Jones Kool- Aid" that was exactly that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All accidents until proven otherwise. He goes to her and begins brushing her hair with his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how happy I'd be if that was really true, Evelyn? And how positively goddamn delirious if you weren't fucking every living thing in our area code at the same goddamn time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which part of that fantasy turns you on most: me with other men -- or just the other men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know everything you do gets me hot. His grip on her hair suddenly tightens and twists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- just not always in the sexual sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hurting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. She jabs his hand with a plasma-red, Dragon Lady-length thumbnail. He lets her go and sucks on a knuckle -- she's drawn blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, there's the simple country gal I married. Let's go back down and greet your guests -- show them the real you: corny as Kansas on the Fourth of July.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guests were shredded. It's your sick little scene now, Steven: enjoy. I'm going to go run scalding water on the places you just touched me, and then I'm calling a cab. She storms into the bathroom adjoining and slams that doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just off the foyer. The furniture, though dust-caked and rotting is antique Deco and sumptuous. Liquor and a lavis buffet have been set out on a sideboard that looks like o of Dali's limp pocket-watches. As Price enters the room grimly, he's descended upon by an angry Pritchett:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Price: I've done everything we agreed on, your guests are all here and in one piece -- my 25 thousand now, please. Price produces an envelope froa his jacket and taps it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here, Mr. Pritchett. As well as five other bona fide, bank drafts for one million dollars each. Made out to cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we get this money when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second the sun hits tomorrow morning. Assuming you have stayed the entire night - and you're still alive, of course. Any other questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why's there five checks? There's only four of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're forgetting my lovely wife; she's part of the same winner-take-all as the rest of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. Detail I guess I forgot to mention. You die, you lose. Your check gets divvied-up by those still amongst the living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you playing here, Price?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very, very scary game. But then look at the bright side: if there's only one of you still upright at dawn, you'll be leaving here with five million dollars in your pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But, hey, anybody who's not "comfortable" with the rules, you're free to walk, anytime. Seven digits poorer, goes without saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Mr. Pritchett, let me just sign the damn thing. Price sits at a rusting octagonal wire-and-steel desk, kn open his envelope, and produces a pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two "T"s at the end of the name. Price looks up, puts the pen down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for the record: what are the rest of your names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald W. Blackburn, M.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa Margaret Marr, Celebrity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie Moses, Communications Attache -- which translated from ancient bullshit means: I work for a Messenger service. Beat. All eyes have now turned to Sara, who's just standi there nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, young lady? She blurts out the lie as one word:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer-Jenzen-Executive-V.P.- Paragon-Pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. Well, I think I can say with complete honesty: I've never heard of any of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what the hell are we doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you make your guest list, Price: throw darts at a phone book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not my list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got an engraved -- literally -- invitation -- with my name --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'm sure you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all maybe getting a little too strange --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I wouldn't worry, Ms. Jenzen: the unexplainable will probably explain herself before too long. In the meantime, let's all relax, have a drink, the evening's young --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- it's getting older by the second. Mr. Price, if I could just please have --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Pritchett, here you go. He signs the check and hands it to Pritchett who spins on heels and starts quickly for the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're gonna miss the bash of a lifetime --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- my loss --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- even if I give you a million as well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't know what to do with it all -- -- and then, suddenly, we hear the distant sound of heavy MACHINES at work. Pritchett freezes for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavy rusted GEARS somewhere in the house, CRUNCHING as they begin to turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Pritchett is sprinting like a madman to the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please -- God-in-Heaven, no --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NOISE inside the room, inside the entire house, is deafening. Price senses something:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows -- Pritchett makes the long run across the huge room towards

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ancient LEVERS snapping down like punches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! The windows being sealed off by heavy IRON PLATES slamming into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! The front door being likewise sealed by a descending IRON PLATE -- nearly decapitating Pritchett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! BAM! BAM! BAM! BAM! Every window, door, and portal o any kind in the house likewise being slammed-sealed shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where everybody stands silent, breathless, and not a little afraid, as the sound of SLAMMING IRON is heard ech everywhere in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pritchett making a literal last dive for the one window i the foyer that is still partially unsealed, its iron plat closing fast --

dialogues.speaker: -- NOOOOOOOO
dialogues.text: -- BAM! The ancient LEVERS smashing down all the way to t concrete floor: mission completed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That final BAM! resounding in the Main Salon. And then silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that is enter-fucking- tainment! Eddie Moses tries to yank up one of the plates -- all he for his efforts is two handfuls of rust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing's going nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is someone's idea of a joke -- -- an agonized SCREAM in response; it's coming from the Foyer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Pritchett's not laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price & Guests entering and greeted by the sight of: Watson Pritchett - Hair wild, clothes torn, SCREAMING as tries to pry the cast-iron plate off the Foyer window wit his bare hands --

dialogues.speaker: -- NO
dialogues.text: -- he's ripping his fingernails off, blood coursing down arms. PRICE runs to him, yanks him from the window and to floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pritchett!! Pritchett stops screaming, looks up at Price in utter ter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blackburn! His hands, do something! Blackburn races over, takes one look. Yells to Sara:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bottle of vodka on the sideboard: get it! She races into the other room. Blackburn takes his handkerchief and puts it on Pritchett's wounds. Pritchett doesn't so much as whimper, keeps staring at Price. In a daze:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pritchett, what the hell just happened here? Pritchett looks up at him, eyes not quite focused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lockdown. Sara dashes back in with the bottle of vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? Blackburn takes the liquor and begins cleaning/disinfecti Pritchett's wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mechanism. From the old Asylum. For Emergencies. Sealed the whole place shut. Top to bottom. That's how come they all burned to death in '31. Dr. Vannacutt threw the switch. If he was gonna die, they all were gonna die, and so they were toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder they're still pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only ones who survived were five of Vannacutt's staff butchers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why in God's name wasn't this thing removed years ago??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was on my Dad's list of "things to do." But the House did him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said that was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lied. The House is alive and we're all gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for chrissake --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- uh, excuse me, just one quick question? How long before this damn thing unseals itself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know that it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then, how 'bout maybe we call someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hasn't been a telephone in this House in over 60 years. Blackburn, Price and Melissa Marr all chime in unintentio unison:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got my cellular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, flip a coin and somebody dial 911!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't do any good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? And then, simultaneously, we hear the same beep-beep-beep from the three cellular phones and see the same flashing message on their LED screens: "No Service - No Service - Service."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be those plates -- interfering with the signal somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the plates: the House. Why is no one listening to me?? It's alive!  And once it's made up its mind, it won't let anything out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what? You're saying we're stuck here the rest of our lives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cleaning crew's supposed to arrive at 9:30 tomorrow morning -- I think the power of the house fades at dawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- well, let's hear it for small miracles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but I imagine we'll all be mutilated beyond recognition by then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, bad times -- hello, Prime Time! She starts shooting tape again -- everything and everybod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something seriously screwed-up going on here, and I don't believe it's about ghosts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- oh, it sure ain't, sweetheart. Heads turn: walking slow, smug and regal down the great staircase into the foyer is EVELYN STOCKARD-PRICE, her co discarded, her neckline loosened -- she realizes she's he for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a bow, Steven, you've outdone yourself tonight -- scared holy hell out of even me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's the fact, Price, okay, you've had your fun -- now open the goddamn --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- asking the wrong guy -- wasn't me who closed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure it wasn't. Hey, anybody else here make their living with thrills'n'chills for the kiddies? Don't raise your hands all at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. And here I had a completely different theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Well, let it rip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no-no-no -- much more bang for everyone's buck to nail the bitch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the sadistic prick --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- in the act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, excuse me? Don't think I'm not having the time of my life watching this train wreck that's your marriage -- but this isn't what I had in mind... I want to know that we can get out of here if we need to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, we need to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pritchett, this "lockdown" thing -- it's gotta have like a master control -- you know machinery, gears, whatever -- somewhere in this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basement -- but, believe me, you don't want to go down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't want to go down there. I am going down there. And I'm going to find reverse on this thing and floor it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never find it, it's a maze down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that leaves you with two options then, doesn't it: either show me where and maybe we get out of here -- or it's spend-the-night-sleep-tight. Pritchett leaps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's actually very easy when you know the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A word of advice, honey? God knows what kind of freak-outs Steven's got set to spring in this place. If I were you, I'd bring something to protect yourself with. Baby, don't you think now's the time to I break out your "party favors?" Price suddenly looks uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be getting old, Stevie -- you're repeating yourself -- this is the exact same set-up you used for the Son-Of-Sam Hunt back in '94. (to Sara)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girlie, open up that casket there and see what you find. Sara glares at her, but does as she's told: goes to the l ebony casket that supports Evelyn's BIRTHDAY CAKE. Sara l back at Evelyn suspiciously... then sets the cake aside a lifts the lid. Inside that, seemingly free floating in space, are SIX MI COFFINS -- no more than eight inches long, their doors likewise propped open, revealing inside each a gleaming n GLOCK 9mm AUTOMATIC. Each pistol black gunmetal in color, course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh, nice: firearms this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warped factor here just gets bigger and bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven's sense of humor just makes you want to bust a gut, don't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in stitches. Sara takes one of the guns and attempts to eject the magazine. Nothing happens. She looks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clip's been welded shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On all of them, probably. Evelyn takes one of the pistols and points it at her husb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how's a girl to know if these things are loaded, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one way I can think of, Sweetheart. Tense beat, ala Eastwood and Hackman staring each other d at the end of "Unforgiven." Then Evelyn lowers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I think we'll let the young lady have first crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want a gun, I just want out. Let's go, for God's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll meet you down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sara)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the gun. Sara takes the pistol from Evelyn, and Pritchett unenthusiastically beckons Eddie and Sara towards a hallw leading to the basement. Price trots towards another door the Salon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where are we off to, Mr. Price? Check the wiring on the animatronic Mummies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A simple leak, if it's okay with you. And he disappears down the hall. Melissa Marr jams a cigarette in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow... She flicks her lighter, sparking a flame to life --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a flurry of crackling SPARKS showers Watson Pritchett he twists the '20's vintage knob light switch. He leaps b with a frightened yelp. We see a brief BURST OF LIGHT from the ancient sconces on walls, revealing a series of moldy, cobwebbed and rubble- strewn basement gallery, and a series of five glass cases filled with the mummified remains of human bodies... One odd human figure rides upon a mummified horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An odd multi-walled gallery from which five corridors lea out, extending like the spokes of a wagon wheel -- -- and then every LIGHT down there SHORTS OUT with one lo SIZZLING POP! Total darkness. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, this'd actually be funny -- if I didn't know for a fact I'd be pleading for a quick, painless death in the next few seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could somebody please just gag him or something? Sara reaches into her bag and pulls out the flashlight Pritchett gave her earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a handy little thing to have around. Suddenly, a terrible cracking sound is heard above Sara's head. She aims her light at the large beam overhead. Just then, the beam gives way. Eddie pulls her away just in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're not really as large and useless as you seem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm better than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't push it. She thrusts the flashlight into Pritchett's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now take us where this damn thing's at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price bursts through a hinged panel and whisper-shouts to Schechter behind the computer/video console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- hey! Next time give me a couple seconds notice before you wing a gag like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lockdown thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, not that it didn't give Evelyn the kind of coronary I had in mind, just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- it wasn't me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rewind that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just sitting here -- it happened. I had nothing to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who did??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea. I didn't even know the damn thing still worked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it was just its time to finally fall apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Somehow -- I don't know how -- she did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty amazing feat: all that shit down the basement and your wife's up in the bedroom the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take your eyes off her for a second. I think she just declared War.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn, a huge drink in her hand, holding forth to a not terribly interested Dr. Blackburn. Melissa Marr's oblivio Camcorder to her eye, slowly dollying herself out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd've been splitsville years ago, with me the richest single woman in recorded history -- but Steven doesn't "believe" in divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too big on it myself -- but then again, not on marriage either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's got no problem with that: I'm his fourth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need for divorce and that messy division-of-assets thing when they kick before you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three of his previous wives just up and died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnedest thing: each one, freaky little "accidents" --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara, Eddie and Pritchett continue searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should really open this place to the public, Pritchett -- a spa for people without enough stress in their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said we shouldn't come down here. Very treacherous -- physical and metaphysical levels, both. There've been no refurbishments to this part of the house -- it's exactly as it was in 1931.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a fact, Mr. Pritchett? They all whip around -- spooked to the max. Pritchett sha trains the flashlight on who or what's behind them: Price

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good way to get your head blown off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try not to remember to warn Evelyn. They soon pass a broken wall. Rubble and debris litters t floor. Pritchett moves them quickly past the spot. This doesn't go unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (too quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Sara takes the flashlight from Pritchett's hand and aims into the dark hole beyond.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR
dialogues.text: The light glints on a HUGE STEEL DOOR. A grime-covered WINDOW is set at eye-level. A black mold corrodes away th edges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing? That seems like quite a door to hold back "nothing". Pritchett just stares at the door for an uncomfortably lo moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What's in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Soul of the House. Everything that's corrupt about it... My father trapped it in there just before he died. You see, he purchased the house to restore it... We were going to live here... Nothing can live here. I was just a kid... The first time I saw it, I thought it was beautiful... It was just a dark mist turning into the corner of the room... then it started to move... then death started to happen... First the workers.. six in all... then my father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ghosts killed your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not ghosts... at least not what you're thinking... Vannacutt used to dump the bodies of his failed experiments somewhere in the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think it's in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accumulated evil... festering for decades... (switching gears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm a drunk... so don't listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're saying as long as that door stays locked, we're okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell NO!! The House will kill ya! Pritchett's oblivious: he's shining his light back down t corridor -- at its terminus it splits into four new corridors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we go down there and take a right. The trio follow Pritchett. WE remain staring at the STEEL DOOR. Almost imperceptibly -- or is it the darkness playi tricks on us? One of the streaks of mold seems to have gr longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pritchett leading the three others down a new corridor, clearly clueless as to where the hell they are. Shines th flashlight up to find they're in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a small room containing a large leather table with a myri of mildewed buckle-straps attached. Behind the table: a monolithic brass and wood DYNAMO that looks powerful enou to keep Orange County lit for a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electro-shock therapy. There's several of them hooked together... Dr. Vannacutt liked to zap his patients in multiples of ten. More enerqy-efficient or something. Let's try a left. They turn left. A small, barely noticeable arc of electri zaps from a dangling, half-severed wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pritchett dead-ended in another room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn-it-all! This is the Saturation Chamber! Left again! He all but yanks Price along with him, Price blurting as disappears from frame:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a "Saturation Chamber"? EDDIE and SARA linger, staring at the big, cast-iron caps shaped contraption. We hear Pritchett's Voice in the distance, explaining:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New wrinkle on an old theory for treating schizophrenia. 19th Century, I think: what would drive a sane man mad should make a madman sane. The Vannacutt version was: bombard the patient with aural and visual stimuli far more frightening than any hallucination they could ever produce, it'd traumatize 'em back to "normalcy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it work? Eddie looks up: Pritchett and Price are nowhere to be see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Where'd you guys go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left, goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Eddie's arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon -- I've got like zero interest in getting lost down here. He guides her out of the room and down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- to his left. PULL BACK -- And we see, simultaneously, Pritchett, Price and flashlight walking down the corridor that was to thei left -- Eddie and Sara walking down the one that was to their left: a long, snaking passage going in the complete opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Sara navigating the various twists and turns in darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Price! Pritchett! Sara's gaze falls on: A RAGGED HOLE above their heads, broken into the wall of the corridor. CABLES and WIRES ca be seen inside the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme try something. Gimme a boost. Eddie grabs her by her butt. She bristles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- hey, pal, that wasn't code for -- -- and with his considerable strength, lifts Sara in the so she's sitting on his hands like a chair --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where you need to go? As much as she tries to stifle it, Sara lets loose a gigg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three steps forward -- I want to get up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whole place can't be wired to just one circuit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pritchett and Price taking a hard right into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We recognize the rusted gears from the "lockdown" sequenc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo! He shines the light through the cavernous space: an immen mechanism of cams, pulleys and counterweights. Price star in absolute awe -- this is something straight out of the Industrial Revolution. He eyes the bank of long-handled, mother-of-pearl tipped levers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara with her hands deep in the recess behind the wall sconce, yanking and re-connecting wires until -- she gets a spark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It burns her fingers and she yelps -- but the lights in t corridor FLICKER ON for a moment. And then again. And aga It's a lousy source of illumination, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- better than nothing. Down, big fella'. Eddie lowers her back down to earth -- his hand lingering a moment on her bottom. Their eyes meet for a nanosecond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most fun I've had all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get out more. They start walking down the weirdly pulsing corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, who are you really? Sara stiffens for a second. Then, calmly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Deep down inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start with the name you were born with, and we'll work forward from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you already: Jennifer Jenzen, Executive V.P. of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of my business is making deliveries to high rollers. And I have yet to meet one Executive who could tie their own shoes -- let alone rewire an entire house. You don't fit the bill -- not even close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's always exceptions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in the movie biz. So, c'mon, gimme the truth. Ahead of them, Sara sees the corridor splits into two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is, if we keep taking rights, we're going to have to end up where we started. She beckons him to follow her, starts walking down the corridor to the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we're all gonna be out of here in a little while and go our separate ways, all a million bucks richer. What's it matter who I am or who I'm not? There's no response from Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... So let's say, hypothetically, I'm not exactly who I should be -- okay, so you're right, you're a genius, I don't know anybody who could've ever seen right through me like that -- does that end the discussion? No response from Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, look: my real name is Sara, and I'm a secretary -- was, anyway -- to the real Jennifer Bitch who was invited here, and now you know and I'm begging you don't tell anybody, 'cuz I'm out of a job and could really use even a tenth of that money, okay? No response from Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I just get a "yes" or a "no"?? She turns: Eddie's nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pritchett and Price stand in the "Lockdown" control room, staring at a rusted lever that Price has snapped off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We may have to...look for other means to get out of here. Price looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to what's-their-names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara trotting down one CORRIDOR --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara moving and picking up speed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is your idea of funny, think again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara moves even faster:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, you're really starting to piss me off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And suddenly, she slams on the brakes -- because at the f end of this Corridor, she spots: EDDIE - quick-stepping right-to-left through the intersection ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, pal: game called on account of boredom, let's go -- And then she sees: in the strobe-flicker of light, his EY look devoid of pupils, as though replaced by something METALLIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie...?? Eddie keeps walking, turns into another corridor and disappears from sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your problem? She runs after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara again spots Eddie at the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! He keeps on walking, turns into a room, disappears from sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I was actually starting to like you, you creep! Nonetheless, she chases after him into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara stops, scared. God-knows what this room's purpose wa long ago, now it's just a space filled with enormous glas tanks, vat-like things filled with BLOOD. But no Eddie. S shouts to the air:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you win. You've successfully creeped me out. -- and then her EYES GO WIDE as she spots EDDIE -- perched above a Vat -- he's teetering, his equilibrium like a marionette's -- in danger of dropping right into the Vat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing -- -- Eddie drops like a stone into the Vat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Eddie!! She scrambles up to the top of the Vat, looks down into i nothing but that thick opaque muck -- but there's SOMETHI ROILING beneath it. Sara plunges her arms down into it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Eddie! Eddie! Oh my god! -- BAM! Something does -- yanking her down hard into the -- and continuing to pull -- she's to her shoulders in it and her head's about to go in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Eddie!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here. Sara darts the one eye still above the muck-line behind h EDDIE MOSES -- is standing in the doorway, a completely baffled expression on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on, you lose something down there? SARA -- looks back down into the Vat in horror. Lets out a scream. Whatever's in there releases her arms and she goes tumbling ass-over-teakettle down to the floor, her arms released. Eddie runs to her, takes her in his arms, sopping himself the same blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Are you okay? Sara has no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pritchett enters the room. The blood-caked Eddie and Sara stumble in, right behind them. Pritchett grimaces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's marked the two of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose it's too much to hope that all that blood means -- A grim-faced Price enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- nope, he's still alive. She pours herself another huge drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn, could you just zip it for a moment? It looks like we're stuck here 'til morning -- let's make the best of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best of a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something very not normal going on here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This? This is nothing. You've only been dealing with the House itself. You have no idea what you're tinkering with. Sooner or later, the darkness that is at the core will get out... One of you will release it... Not meaning to, of course... then... (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Bye, bye, Miss American Pie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pritchett, what is this "core of darkness"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you understood.... It's the souls of Vannacutt's dead... The insanity... The horror... Victims burned alive... All that pain percolating somewhere in the house for seventy-some years... (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...singing this will be the day that I die... This will be the day that I.... He makes a beeline for the sideboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be some other way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, until that's found, I think it's a good idea we all stick together. (turns to his wife)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or wouldn't that fit into your plans, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine with me. Just somebody then better go and round up Melissa Marr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stalking the wild poltergeist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIDEO IMAGE: A DARKENED HALLWAY rife with grainy shadows. The image cruises down the corridor, peering into the twisting passageways that intersect our path as we drift like some Flying Dutchman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and we see that we've been watching from the POV of Melis Marr's CAMCORDER. She's gliding up and down the hallway, eye glued to the viewfinder, taking in every square inch the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bumps and pits in the carved-stone CORRIDOR walls are becoming more vivid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa seen taking a left into ANOTHER HALLWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: an ODD SHADOW plays in the corner at the end of this new hallway. The CORRIDOR appears to grow smaller, more claustrophobic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa letting loose a half-uneasy, half-exhilarated gul She stops walking. Slowly lowers the Camcorder, scans the end of the hall with her naked eye: Other than having the creepy ambience as the rest of the house, the hall appears normal again: large and long with a trace of anything extraordinary. She returns her eye to viewfinder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the SHIFTING SHADOW she saw before disappears into an OPE DOOR at the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curiouser and curiouser. We're talking a fifty share, minimum. -- just then: a murmur of MANY VOICES heard around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa lowers the CAMCORDER, eyes darting everywhere, scared -- but she sees nothing. CAMERA back up to her eye She moves to the doorway. As she turns the corner, we see the PATTERN ON THE WALL. It is really a painting done in ANAMORPHOSIS - it has now become a terrible Gothic demon, ready to strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We reach the vault-like door and peer down the steps that disappear into a pool of darkness. The VOICES heard again Indistinct basso. Emanating from somewhere below. We descend down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MELISSA comes to a stop at the bottom of the stairs: her go wide at the sight before her. WILD IMAGES painted by some long-dead madman, start on th floor, sweep up across the wall and onto the ceiling. SHE PEERS CLOSER, sees: that they're images of torture an death painted in blood. MELISSA stares at them, wide-eyed She puts the camera back up to her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the IMAGES come alive: WRITHING in AGONY, what passes for their mouths open wide in silent screams. Melissa is awe- struck:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me bald. She moves down the corridor to a room at the end. A sign proclaims "CEREBRAL HYGIENE". As she nears, the voices gr louder. And now mixed in with them are terrible MOANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa enters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strange room filled with odd devices is laid out before Clearly left over from another era, quack electric machin and bizarre instruments line the walls. In the middle of the room, a small group of PEOPLE in whi stand huddling urgently around something, their backs to A MAN in white, off to the side, is filming whatever it i going on with a spring-wound 16mm CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... And then the Huddled Group whips around, revealing the objects of their-activity: TWO HUMANS -- crammed together on one gurney: a Woman in a savaged Nurse's uniform; a Man, in what little is left his surgical scrubs, a name plate pinned right into his flesh: "Vannacutt." Both SCREAMING like banshees as they're being VIVISECTED. It is the identical image we saw on the B&W footage from at the beginning of the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a GASP, MELISSA pulls the camera from her eye. She looks at the room: the equipment is all there but the room is completely EMPTY of anything living. She lets out a small sigh of relief and TURNS to leave -- -- and suddenly in front of her is... THE PATIENT... that Vannacutt and Nurse had originally been dissecting. He's jittering so fast he's a blur. And then he lunges at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCREAMS of Melissa Marr echo wildly in the room -- lo agonized HOWLS that just grow louder and louder. Everyone looks up in alarm -- with the exception of Evelyn, whose focus is on pouring herself a new drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be old Melissa found what she was looking for. As the SCREAMS grow even more hideous, Price and Guests d out of the room. Pritchett downs the rest of his huge tum of Scotch, then proceeds very halfheartedly after them -- and then the SCREAMS stop. Pritchett sits back down in hi chair, pours another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead. Chalk up one for the House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price and Blackburn striding down a long hallway, eyes darting everywhere, shouting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Marr! And then hearing from down in the basement:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus: down here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price and Blackburn arrive to see Eddie and Sara standing outside the door labeled "Cerebral Hygiene."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ....I don't...know. The two men follow their gaze. To the FLOOR. Lying there MARY'S CAMCORDER the lens shattered, the hand-grip broken off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something just must've...frightened her, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...something. Sara holds up her finger: it's drenched with fresh blood. with it, she points into the empty room. On the tile is a wide, red and glistening DRAG MARK leading from the doorw to the foot of the half-rotted... OPERATING TABLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Price and Blackburn run into the room. Blackburn kneels d examines the drag mark. Utterly baffled and not a little unnerved:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just...stops here. Sara sticks her head in the door, nervously:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe....maybe she went up on the table. Price runs a finger along the table bed; he's able to dig trench the entire length of it through the three-inches-d worth of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody, nothing's been on this in...67 years. Eddie stomps into the room, frightened and frustrated, tr to make sense of it all:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she went somewhere! She didn't just up and disappear into thin air!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...not air -- The three men turn to look at her -- Sara's staring at something above them: a spot on the... CEILING directly o the Operating Table, where the bloody DRAG MARKS resume, continuing all the way to the point where concrete ceilin meets equally solid wall, and then vanish altogether.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- into the House. They just stare at the sight in dead, scared-shitless silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's gotta be some way out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie seen haranguing a near-dead drunk Pritchett:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- of this place, goddamnit, Pritchett!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Pritchett drains the last drops of his tumbler of Scotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alcoholic coma, if you hurry. He starts to pour another -- -- Eddie swats both glass and bottle out of his hand; the SHATTER on the floor. In this tension-packed room, the so is magnified a hundred-fold. Blackburn all but jumps out his skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus H. Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eddie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't calm the hell down I'm gonna strap you in for electro-shock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving his pistol)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you gonna manage that with a new blow-hole in your dome?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, if everybody's gonna kill each other, could you do it in another room? I'm trying to get something accomplished here. We see that Sara's sitting at a desk in the room, fiddlin with the innards of Melissa Marr's camcorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell good is fixing that gonna get us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An answer, I hope: exactly what -- or who -- Melissa was taping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it this way: if it's your face on that tape, Mr. Moses, we're one gunshot away from solving all our problems --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it! Something, anyway... The room goes silent -- on the PLAYBACK SCREEN on the sid the CAMCORDER, an erratic, wildly rolling IMAGE can be se Everyone present, Pritchett included, starts gravitating towards Sara and the desk. She hits the STOP button on th Camcorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motor's working, but the tape's pretty much D.O.A. -- I could only rewind it back a couple of feet. Don't blink, this is probably the first and only showing. She punches PLAY. And we see on the

dialogues.speaker: CAMCORDER'S PLAYBACK
dialogues.text: soundless: a vision of free flight -- the lens capturing what it saw as it dropped to the ground: a wild, herky- jerky, ass-over-teakettle melange of -- WALL/CEILING/MARY'S HAIR -- and, finally: FLOOR as the lens smacks TILE, fractures into a starburst of cracks, topples onto its side. And through this veil of JAGGED, SPIDERY LINES, we see: MARY'S HAND drop into frame -- lie still for a moment -- and then start VIOLENTLY SPASMING, as a BLOODSTORM starts spattering it from O.S. Until the color of her flesh can no longer be seen -- A METAL CRUNCH is heard from inside the CAMCORDER, and th image on the screen goes to BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one moves -- they're all frozen there, staring at the screen. Beat. And then: the sound of light APPLAUSE is he Heads turn towards its source, and we see: EVELYN STOCKARD-PRICE leaning against one of the walls, h hands slowly, almost angrily CLAPPING. She doesn't speak, she seethes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Game, set and match, Steven. You've outdone yourself. And I know it's not good manners to ask the magician how he did it, but inquiring minds are desperate to know: just what did really happen to Ms. Marr?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asking the wrong person again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, did she stage it all for you and then go hide -- or did you just flat out kill the little bitch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I pose you the same question --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and who's next on your list?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had one, Evelyn, I think you know who'd be first and last --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- oh, for chrissake, that's a given; we all know that knocking me off is the bottom line here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- that wasn't my original plan, but it is starting to look more attractive --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- thank you! All the cards finally on the goddamn table! She produces one of the Glocks and points it at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just know I'm not gonna make it easy for you. We still don't know the answer to the Million Dollar Question -- -- Evelyn fires the gun into the wall just to the left of Price's head. It smashes a hole there the size of a fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Question answered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They weren't loaded when I put them in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funky little house, ain't it? (turns to the Guests)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends, your hostess is now going to retire for what's left of the night. If you need me, I'll be in the bedroom upstairs -- but try and fight that need: the door'll be locked, I'll be trying to sleep, and if anyone so much as breathes in the keyhole, I'm gonna empty this thing into their fucking head. Thank you all for the bestest birthday a girl could have. She walks away and begins climbing the stairs. Price turn the guests to see that every eye in the room is staring a him -- and not without fear. Price is astonished, then ju shakes his head with disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if I were inclined, I've had better -- and a lot safer -- opportunities to kill off a wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three times, to be exact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accidents. Fatal. Each of your prior wives, so we've been informed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't imagine by who. I don't suppose the truth would interest you: that I've never had another wife but Evelyn. No response, just looks of confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Married. Once. Same woman. All these years. She just slithered up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prove it how? Sara strides to the coffin-cabinet and withdraws one of t Glocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what are you planning on doing with that? She cocks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just decided a million bucks is worthless if you ain't around to spend it. There is a way out of this place, and I'm gonna either find it or create it. (to Eddie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming or staying? Eddie looks at his options: Price, Blackburn & Pritchett or Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what the hell, I'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too. Blackburn takes a gun from the coffin and cocks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More the merrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm going back to try and find Ms. Marr. If she's hurt, I'll tend to her. Dead, then I'm coming back for him. He glares at Price and exits in the opposite direction. Long beat. Price stares at the befuddled Pritchett who se to be having a quiet conversation with himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think...I may have the answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember...it was a long time ago...my father said: when the House was finally completed, make sure...we-christen-it- with-this-bottle-of-dirt-cheap-champagne- that-should-still-be-in a cupboard somewhere! Pritchett is out of his chair extremely fast for someone a near-lethal blood alcohol level. As he makes his exit, grabs one of the last Glocks. Turns sheepishly to Price:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing personal. He chambers a shell and exits. Beat. Price is alone in th room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn, goddamnit -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and bursts through the hinged panel into computer central, shouting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Schecter, how is she pulling this off!? Schecter doesn't turn, all his attention focused on the computer screen, his fingers stopped dead in the their tr upon the keys as though suddenly terrified by something. Price looks at the computer screen. Two words typed there Someone Else

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? Schecter stays frozen. Price is beside himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schecter, what the hell does it mean?? He whips Schecter around in his swivel chair -- and comes literally face-to-face with -- a Man who no longer has a face! It's like someone took a giant melon-baller to Schecter's head, scooping out everything -- just leaving rind that's the interior wall of his skull. Well, mostly everything: there's still bits of bloody brain pulp hangi from the bone. Needless to say: he's dead. Price turns away, gagging in horror -- and his eye is caught by a flash of motion in a -- VIDEO MONITOR -- the one trained on the Main Salon A FIGURE (VANNACUTT) DRESSED ALL IN WHITE standing by the sideboard, looking up into the CAMERA -- a strange stainless-steel device in his hands that looks half- surgical saw/half-speculum. Something dark and wet drippi from its knife-sharp edges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone else. Not Evelyn -- Price's Eyes jump to --

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO MONITOR
dialogues.text: -- plain as day, there's Evelyn under the covers. Price's eyes dart back to the SALON MONITOR -- the Figure White is no longer there. But Price catches a flash: the to the corridor just swinging shut! Price jumps to his fe and tears-ass out of the small room, screeching:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's someone else in the House!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Sara pulling with all their might on the iron g to one of the windows. Eddie stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear somebody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- keep pulling, it's moving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Blackburn, armed with Sara's flashlight and his medic bag, strides with determination through the labyrinth. Th stops when he hears a faint VOICE in the distance:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blackburn! Blackburn finds he's stopped right by the door to the "Cerebral Hygiene" room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Marr...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the locks on the door, deadbolt and knob-lock both SNAP OPEN simultaneously. Beat. In the distance, a VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone else -- ! The door SLAMS. WHIP-PAN to Evelyn's bed: clearly it's be slept in -- but now it's completely empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pritchett on his hands and knees going through a large cabinet, tossing books and papers over his shoulder in a frenzy of frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- in the House!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know -- it's gotta be here somewhere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price tearing down the stairs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sonovabitch, where are you, I saw you!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Sara drop their arms from the window, exhausted But there is now a space about two inches wide between IR GRATE and OPEN WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, with three days and a blowtorch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a thousand years old -- we just need a crowbar or something to get leverage -- the sucker'll pop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No prob: I'll just hop down the hardware store --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- no. The basement -- the room with all the controls to this thing: big long iron levers just lying there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- not a chance -- there's too much weirdness down there I don't think even bullets are gonna stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're starting to sound like Pritchett. -- and then the LIGHTS zap to BLACK and Sara SHRIEKS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Pritchett shrieks as the LIGHTS ZAP BACK ON -- blindin then OFF AGAIN -- then ON --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the lights in the wall sconces are strobing like an epileptic's worst nightmare. The sheer schizo-psychedelia it all has Dr. Blackburn frozen in his tracks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as is Price. -- then the SOUND starts. Price is first to hear it -- it puts an expression on his face like someone is ramming bo eardrums with icepicks over and over again: A LOUD CRACKLING ELECTRIC SURGE -- on-again, off-again, in direct sync with the dimming of the lights. What makes it so especially unsettling is the noise that accompanies each Sledgehammer Surge: a straining, strangulating CRY. noise like a calf would make as its throat is slit. The light-show be damned, Price leaps down the stairs, sprinting towards the Noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- likewise Dr. Blackburn --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- likewise Sara and Eddie, running as fast as they can -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price spies Blackburn at the other end of a Corridor, sho over the Noise to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!! Sara and Eddie appear, spot them; Sara shouts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something with the power, I don't know!! And then Pritchett is seen at the far end of another Corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's down there! He's pointing to a long corridor - a light strobes at the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awe-struck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The...Fourth of July.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you babbling, you lunatic?? And then clarity comes to Price's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electro-shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and the Noise suddenly stops. The lights stop pulsing. Pitch dark and dead quiet. Eddie squints and points at something deeper in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something -- -- MOVING inside the Room. Blackburn lashes his arm out, stopping anyone from going any further into the room. He whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move, don't make a sound... In the darkness, in the distance, they can make out AN ANIMATE PRESENCE at waist level. Pale. With something flowing from its sides, almost wing-like. And it's squirming, undulating like a snake -- and then, softly this time, that calf-like cry. High-pitched, almost femal sounding. Price ducks under Blackburn's arm and starts walking slow into the room, towards it. No one tries to stop him. ON PRICE as he gets closer, and can see that whatever it is, it's perched atop one of the TABLES -- -- the CRY -- and Price steps closer, and he can make out to the side of the table, something that looks like....a hand? -- the CRY -- closer now: a hand discerned -- human -- wi rings on the fingers, polish on the nails --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Ms. Marr...? -- no response -- just the CRY -- Price reaches out to touch that hand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it Melissa?? -- a look of horror comes to Price's face:

dialogues.speaker: OH JESUS NO
dialogues.text: -- and then lights flash BLINDING WHITE -- and the bug-ey face of EVELYN STOCKARD-PRICE is seen -- screaming that C through the RUBBER BITE-DOWN that's been taped tight to h teeth -- -- her head, her torso, her limbs BUCKING like they're je propelled against the leather straps restraining her -- -- as the MASSIVE VOLTS of electricity from the DYNAMO sh wired to punch into her like ten thousand razors at once -- and Price reaches for her instinctively -- -- only to have Blackburn lunge in and yank his hand away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- are you crazy!?! -- and for a moment all anyone can do is watch as Evelyn gets jolted and slammed again and again and again -- and sparks fly from the electrodes on her head and smoke star to billow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it off!! Somebody turn the damn thing off!! En masse, the Guests charge into the room, scrabbling everywhere around the DYNAMO, looking for a wire, anythin they can use to stop the current ripping through her body -- and Price is near-insane, smashing buttons, yanking switches off their moorings as he watches the pupils disappear from the eyes of his bucking, jerking wife -- -- and Sara pulls a cord from a socket in the wall and nothing happens -- -- and Blackburn spies something running down the table leg -- -- and Price is literally SCREAMING -- -- and Blackburn yanks the table-leg wire with all his might -- -- and everything stops. The light show. The screaming. T smoke. -- and Evelyn, too. Her body drops back down on the table with a horrible THUD. Her eyes stare sightlessly. Blackbu leans over her. Head to her chest, a finger to her neck. Beat. And then he stands back up straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- she's not dead! Just have to get her heart pumping aqain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouth-to-mouth! Price yanks the bite-piece from Evelyn's mouth -- a plume purple ARTERIAL BLOOD spews from her lips and cascades al over her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrenaline -- in your bag, Blackburn, you must have --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- even it we were in the E.R., Price: it's too late -- her heart's burst! Price puts his ear on Evelyn's chest -- listens -- his fa falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Sara puts two fingers to Evelyn's wrist pulse. Feels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone. Even Pritchett gets into the act, taking the flashlight a shining it into Evelyn's fixed pupils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't get any deader. Price strokes his wife's hair, tears begin to form in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. With his other hand, Price begins to unbuckle the restrai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...don't think...anybody should be touching the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll do what I damn well please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right, Price. It's a matter for the police. He takes Price's hands firmly and removes them from Evely

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is in-fucking-deed. At the risk of stating the obvious: this wasn't exactly a goddamn suicide. He smacks the now-loose steel-and-leather restraint with hand -- in the tense silence of the room, the buckle BANG like a GUNSHOT against the table, over and over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: House 2, Guests 0.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think, Pritchett, we've got a situation here that even you can't explain away as "ghosts." This is ice- cold homicide by person -- or persons -- He glares furiously at his Guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- not entirely unknown. She cocks her pistol and aims it at Price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Convenient place to point blame, hon', but this time, the only wrong one: for all I know, somebody should be pointing that gun at you. She shakes her head and keeps the gun where it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was upstairs with Eddie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- that's the fact, bud --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where the hell were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs, too. Come with me, I'll show you another body, a friend of mine named Schecter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- what was he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running all the bells and whistles we set up to scare hell out of everybody --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the stained glass --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- yeah, we did that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the window and door grates --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- no -- that's when everything went ragtime -- whoever else is in this house has been doing everything since -- I thought it was Evelyn --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- which is why you killed her. And now he takes his pistol and cocks it at Price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was upstairs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never saw you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I did: down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think that's case -- -- likewise producing his gun and chambering a shell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pritchett, you're not joining this necktie party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was upstairs looking for... well, uh... moral support. I don't know what's going on down here, but I like you, and if you say the house didn't kill your wife -- Pritchett fumbles out his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- then I guess then it had to be you. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God -- I was afraid I'd be lynched without a quorum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you've got a gun on you, Price, I'd hand it over now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just yet. Would any of you be interested in knowing exactly why I ended up here in the basement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
