dialogues.text: I was chasing after somebody I saw in the salon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really: who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't catch his or her name, just followed them down here. Somebody all in white surgical gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly terrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vannacutt!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or somebody wanting me to believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then just wait -- maybe this whoever's got you next on the Asylum's equipment- test list. Maybe a literal mind-blow inside the "Saturation Chamber."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take my chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't, sweetheart. And now Price produces his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there really is someone else in this house, I think the four of us can handle the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think one of you has been part and parcel of making this situation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun, Price; hand it over: now. Price cocks his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't test me, I'm real prepared to use this to stay alive --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- confirming everything we already know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'll take the chance, come morning and cops, I'll be proved right -- -- Sara advances --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you lose either way, Price --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- listen to the man --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- listen to me, goddamnit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- no more -- -- she reaches for his gun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- no! And Price pulls the trigger right in her face!

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Only...there's no explosive report, no whine of bullets - just this CLICK! CLICK! CLICK! from Price's gun. The room freezes for a moment -- wide-eyed shock all arou Price looks down at his Glock: the weld on the clip's bee broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who fucked with my gun?? Freeze broken: Eddie lunges for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sonovabitch!! And he tackles Price to the floor, punching the gun from Price's grasp and nailing him in the face a few times for good measure. Price is down for the count. Pritchett walks towards the stairs. Blackburn looks to Sa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what do we do? We've got to hold him somewhere 'til the police --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the "Saturation Chamber." Where he wanted to put me. Pritchett stops in his tracks on the stairs, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would drive a madman sane would drive a sane man mad. (pauses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a drink. Anyone wants me, I'll either be upstairs or dismembered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price lets out a scream as Eddie SLAMS the door to the "Saturation Chamber". Price's face appears in the small porthole. Sara twists the WHEEL that seals tight the cast-iron, cap shaped device. Asks Blackburn:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty old and rusted out -- you sure this thing'll hold him? Through the single small window on the side, we can see a furious, panicked Price slam his full weight against the inside of the door. It doesn't budge a millimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think it'll be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eddie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. Through the Chamber window, we see Price make another fut CRASH against the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't somebody like, stand guard or something -- just in case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stay, if it'll ease your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? You'll be alright by yourself? Blackburn pats the gun in his jacket pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not worried. Sara nods, takes Eddie's hand and disappears up the stair Blackburn and Price stare at each other on opposite sides the tiny window. Price is screeching something at him, bu can't hear a word through all that iron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't quite make that out -- what? Price silently bellows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: SARA lands on her face in some pitch-black space. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE PEERS into the hole in the floor: there is only darkness that seems to go on forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara...? Sara...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sara tries to pull herself to her feet she sees: DIRT ROCK beginning to FALL from the strange FORMATIONS surrounding her. And then all becomes clear as to where a who she's with: Beneath all that effluence are the REMAINS of Vannacutt's VICTIMS. Some are missing body parts. Some are only body parts. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie hears her and bolts madly down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara! He races toward the stairwell leading to the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there is a God... He puts his full weight behind him and grabs the crank ag -- pushes down -- and the thing breaks off in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-no-no!!!! Why me, why me, you sonovabitch! In hysterical frustration, he throws the broken flange of metal as hard as he can at the wall. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.text: Yeah. And under other abnormal circumstances, I think this would be the time to seriously jump your bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better put it on hold 'til we find Pritchett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! She rips her shoes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pritchett?? They both bolt and head for the basement stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pritchett moves to the window and freedom. He is about to make it outside when he stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon -- don't grow a conscience now, f'chrissake! He continues out the window -- stops again. Looks heavenw angry and guilty at the same time. Yells to his deity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Move!! They race up the stairs --

dialogues.text: Please. It's been a bad enough day -- -- and now the SHADOW MASS has re-assembled to its new, f enormity. It begins to barrel across the attic towards Pritchett and Sara, who don't have a clue -- Eddie does..
